reviews.review_msg: Everything he says in lecture you've already read in the textbook. Horrible essay questions, far too hard and expects too much from a 1st year course. That said, it's a relatively easy science credit and he is entertaining enough to keep you awake in lecture. I'd take it again, but mainly because my TA was awesome!
One word: AWFUL! Assignments are confusing and he marks harder than any prof I've had (I'm in 3rd year). Wouldn't recommend this course.

This class was quite challenging for someone like me who is scientifically inept. Textbook is informative, but would be better if it covered key words and concepts throughout rather than reading like a novel. Essays were fairly marked, but the final was absolutely killer. Hardest test I've ever written, even though I studied a lot.

He's not a bad prof, seems to know what he's talking about. Course (Hist of science) is pretty interesting and the course load is average, 3 4 page papers that get harder as term goes on. Would only recommend the course if you have an interest in the subject, otherwise you`ll find it dull.

Terrible proff! Most of the material he teaches is very vague, questions for the assignments are not stated clearly. He wrote the textbook and will ask to write papers based on his textbook. What will help is taking the same position as him, cause he marks papers. He is not interested in subject and is sluggish. I would not recommened taking the cl

A great professor. Lectures focus on interesting aspects of material. Pretty easy marker but a little disorganized. Text (he co-authored) is well written and easy to read. No midterm, three 4 page papers. Highly recommended prof/class.

Very clear and intersting lectures. Really helpful with any questions regarding assignments. It is easy to get good marks on his papers if you follow his instructions. Plus this course now counts as a B-SCI credit.
